column1: Registered Nurse  Perinatal Intensive Care Nursing Program Postgraduate S404  George Brown College2024.json
column2: Registered Nurse – Perinatal Intensive Care Nursing
column10: Sally Horsfall Eaton School of Nursing
column37: George Brown College Sally Horsfall Eaton School of Nursing
column52: 15-week program divided into in-class lectures, hands-on clinical days, high fidelity simulation labs, and lectures from specialty staff from SickKids.
column54: Learning opportunities: online lectures, workbooks, textbook readings, case studies, clinical skills learning package, simulation labs, journals references, group discussions.
column63: Knowledgeable professors: Heather and Jennifer. Excellent clinical instructor, Sasha.
column67: Well-organized and structured program with a clear flow in the way the material is taught.
column69: Increased confidence and nursing skills, ability to use critical thinking skills and judgement gained from this course.
column71: The program was the best decision I ever made. I highly recommend it for anyone new to the NICU world or even to those who have a few years under their belt.
